p: The objective of this study was to determine the association between heavy rainfall and HIV prevalence in 21 countries in sub-Saharan Africa from 2005 to 2017. Furthermore, we investigated associations between heavy rainfall and HIV transmission risk, including number of sexual partners and sexually transmitted infections (STIs). We hypothesized that heavy rainfall events are associated with increases in HIV prevalence, as well as higher risk of sexual transmission, with associations more prevalent among women and individuals living in rural areas.
